title: WebOffice_coin
author: WebOffice_coin
content: WebOfficeIn a centralized network, it is very easy for users' data to be tampered with. Enterprises or individuals can use our decentralized network to achieve data security effects.Data Security: By using a decentralized network to store data, you can provide higher data security. Traditional centralized storage methods are vulnerable to hacking or data tampering, while decentralized networks can protect data integrity and confidentiality through distributed storage and encryption techniques.Data Transparency: Decentralized networks are typically public, which means that data stored in the network can be accessed and verified by all participants. This transparency helps build trust, as users can verify the source and authenticity of the data, reducing potential fraud and information asymmetry.Decentralized Control: Traditional centralized storage methods are often controlled and managed by a single entity or organization, which can lead to data misuse or improper use. Decentralized networks eliminate single points of failure and single control by storing data on multiple nodes, making data control more distributed and democratic.Censorship Resistance: Decentralized networks can provide stronger resistance to censorship, allowing data to be disseminated and accessed even in the face of government censorship or blocking. This is particularly important for users living in areas with restricted access to information.Global Accessibility: By storing data on nodes located worldwide, your project can achieve global data access. This means that users can upload and access data regardless of their location, providing services to a wider user base.Users who previously participated in the test network can convert the test network WO to the main network WO in the following ways: --- Create a new address on the main network, send money to this main network address in the test network, and you can exchange it into the main network WO. ---Website: https://weboffice.eu.org/Pool: https://weboffice.eu.org/web/#/poolBlockchain Explorer: https://weboffice.eu.org/web/#/explorerWallet: https://weboffice.eu.org/web/#/walletTwitter: https://twitter.com/WebOfficeCoin

comments.author: abonazer
comments.body: Hello team,I have been mining on the testnet period for about ten days.. I know that mainnet is live now.. but what about my coins I mined before + airdrop coins + top miners reward Huh I opened my wallet with zero balance!! so what's the issue?? and if my coins are back how to swap them to the new chain??? please help but don't tell me to join your Telegram channel because I can't my phone doesn't support the new versions of  Telegram app.. I recommend you to create a discord channel.. any way I'm waiting for your reply.Thank you

comments.author: chifanfan
comments.body: This project doesn't even want to create a desktop wallet and instead uses a web wallet. What's even more outrageous is that the exchange plan is expected to be around November, and it seems like they want to cheat on their computing power for a few more month
